SourceProxy.label: Raw Image Reader
SourceProxy.name: TVRawImageReader

Documentation.long_help: Reads raw regular rectilinear grid data from a file. The dimensions and type of the data must be specified.
Documentation.short_help: Read raw regular rectilinear grid data from a file.

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Image reader reads raw, regular, rectilinear grid (image/volume) data from a file. Because no metadata is provided, the user must specify information about the size, spacing, dimensionality, etc. about the dataset.

StringVectorProperty.name: FilePrefix
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The text string contained in this property specifies the file prefix (directory plus common initial part of file name) for the raw binary uniform rectilinear grid dataset.

StringVectorProperty.name: FilePattern
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The text string contained in the property specifies the format string to determine the file names necessary for reading this dataset. In creating the filenames, %s will be replaced by the prefix and %d by a digit which represents the slice number in Z. The format string is the same as that used by printf.

IntVectorProperty.name: DataScalarType
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property indicates the scalar type of the pixels/voxels in the file(s): short, int, float ...

IntVectorProperty.name: DataByteOrder
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property indicates the byte order of the binary file(s).

IntVectorProperty.name: FileDimensionality
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property indicates whether the file(s) in this dataset contain slices (2D) or volumes (3D).

DoubleVectorProperty.name: DataOrigin
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: The coordinate contained in this property specifies the position of the point with index (0,0,0).

DoubleVectorProperty.name: DataSpacing
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the size of a voxel in each dimension.

IntVectorProperty.name: DataExtent
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the minimum and maximum index values of the data in each dimension (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax, zmin, zmax).

IntVectorProperty.name: NumberOfScalarComponents
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the number of components the scalar value at each pixel or voxel has (e.g., RGB - 3 scalar components).

StringVectorProperty.name: ScalarArrayName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property contains a text string listing a name to assign to the point-centered data array read.

IntVectorProperty.name: FileLowerLeft
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property determines whether the data originates in the lower left corner (on) or the upper left corner (off). Most scientific data is written with a right-handed axes that originates in the lower left corner. However, several 2D image file formats write the image from the upper left corner.
